section.name: Installation Instructions
section.p: The installation of a commandline CEA server has 3 basic parts

subsection.name: Installing the war file
subsection.p: The CEA Controller itself can be installed using any of the standard mechanisms for installing a war file in the J2EE server that you are using. To get a fully working installation there are some configuration steps that are necessary

subsection.name: Basic Configuration
subsection.p: The configuration environment properties detailed below can be set with the tomcat manager. An alternative if it suits your environment better is to set the org.astrogrid.config.url property to point to a file url that contains all the very/value configuration parameters below as simple "key=value" lines.

It is possible to see what values are being picked up by the running server by clicking on the fingerprint menu item of the main server page. Near the bottom of the page, under the heading "Configuration" the configuration values will be listed. Note that if a particular value is being picked up from more than one location, it is the first one that appears in this list that will take precedence.

subsubsection.name: cea.filestore.basedir
subsubsection.p: This is the directory where the server stores the record of each of the application executions

subsubsection.name: cea.commandline.workingdir.file
subsubsection.p: This is the directory where the server stores sets up working directories for each application execution. It should be noted that this directory tree can consume a large amount of space if not cleaned up occasionally.

subsubsection.name: org.astrogrid.registry.admin.endpoint
subsubsection.p: This needs to be set to the URL of a registry admin service endpoint. This is necessary because the server is capable of registering itself.

subsubsection.name: org.astrogrid.registry.query.endpoint
subsubsection.p: This needs to be set to the URL of a registry query service endpoint. This is because the CEC server needs to be able to find the location of other VO services.

subsubsection.name: cea.registry.template.url
subsubsection.p: When registering itself the server needs to know a certain amount of meta information about itself. This information can be supplied in the this template file. If this is not set then some default values will be used, but these will probably lead to misleading registry entries for the server that you are installing.
A suitable template file for customization can be found in cvs and the meaning of the various entries is explained in the IVOA Resource Metadata Standard

subsection.subsubsection:
The service endpoint URL needs to be explicitly set because the service might be behind a firewall and have a different apparent address to the outside world. This is used when telling other services about the location of this service. e.g.
http://astrogrid.jb.man.ac.uk:8080/astrogrid-cea-commandline-SNAPSHOT/services/CommonExecutionConnectorService

subsection.name: Testing the server
subsection.p: When the server has been configured it is possible to do a number of simple self tests on the server by clicking on the "Installation Tests" link from the main administration page. These tests are reasonable simple tests, but any failure will mean that some part of the configuration is invalid.

subsection.name: Registering
subsection.p: Once a CEA server has been successfully configured it is possible to make it register itself with the registry specified by the org.astrogrid.registry.admin.endpoint key
